page.title: 20Radley Village Pub.
page.content: The Bowyer Arms, (named from the old Radley family,) is owned and maintained by the Abingdon brewery, Morlands. The premises include a lounge bar, Public bar and gardens, and ample parking space. Very much a social centre, the pub offers all licensed facilities for drinking on the premises, and an off licence for outside sales. Activities offered are darts, (with competitive teams,) bar billiards, pool, and table games traditional to pubs, like cards and dominoes. The lounge bar has a juke box. There are periodic "raffle evenings", usually Fridays, when many prizes of food and comestibles can be won. These evenings are very popular, as are those when other entertainment is provided "live",- as perhaps a singer guitarist. The management serve lunchtime cooked meals and snacks.
